Hobbit Maaltijd,
Hobbit Meal | location=[[Wikipedia:Rotterdam|Rotterdam]], [[Netherlands]] | date=[[28 March]] [[1958]] | result= | partof= | participants=[[J.R.R. Tolkien]] | description= | references= | gallery=the Hobbit-maaltijd }} {{Quote|that it is now exactly twenty years since I began in earnest to complete the history of our renowned hobbit-ancestors of the [[Third Age]]. I look [[East]], [[West]], [[North]], [[South]], and I do not see [[Sauron]]; but I see that [[Saruman]] has many descendants. We [[Hobbits]] have against them no [[magic]] weapons. Yet, my gentlehobbits, I give you this toast: To the Hobbits. May they outlast the Sarumans and see spring again in the [[trees]].|Finishing statement of Tolkien's speech}} The '''Hobbit-maaltijd'''{{LE|205b}} refers to an event in which [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] participated on [[28 March]] [[1958]]. Tolkien had been invited to [[Wikipedia:Rotterdam|Rotterdam]] for a "Hobbit Dinner" by his Dutch publisher Het Spectrum and the bookseller Voorhoeve & Dietrich.{{webcite|author=Noble Smith|articleurl=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/noble-smith/jrr-tolkien-reveals-the-t_b_5373529.html|articlename=J.R.R. Tolkien Reveals TRUE Meaning Of ‘The Lord Of The Rings’ In Unearthed Audio Recording|dated=22 May 2014|website=[http://www.huffingtonpost.com/ huffingtonpost.com]|accessed=21 December 2016}}[[René van Rossenberg]], "[https://dc.swosu.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=2162&context=mythlore Tolkien's Exceptional Visit to Holland: A Reconstruction]" dated 15 October 1996, ''[[Proceedings of the J.R.R. Tolkien Centenary Conference]]'' ==Background== ===The "Hobbit-maaltijd"=== The dinner was held at an assembly hall, the Flevo-hall, part of a building called the Twaalf Provinciën Huis, that no longer exists. Author [[Wikipedia:Hella Haasse|Hella Haasse]] was one of the guests at the large dinner. ===Tolkien's speech=== Tolkien delivered his brief speech in English and Dutch, in the middle of which is a poem "[[Twenty years have flowed away down the long river]]", in [[Quenya]] and English. His finishing statement is quoted in [[Humphrey Carpenter|Carpenter]]'s ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: A Biography|Biography]]''. In [[1993]], an audio recording of the speech was discovered by [[René van Rossenberg]] (which remains unreleased), who later in [[1995]] published an article in ''[[Mythlore 80]]'' detailing the events of that night. ([https://dc.swosu.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=2162&context=mythlore see here]) An excerpt of the recording appeared in an online article in [[2014]]. Beside the oral deliverance Tolkien also prepared a written manuscript for the speech, which contains three versions of the Quenya poem. In [[2024]], part of the speech and the full texts of the poem are now published as entry 182 in ''[[The Collected Poems of J.R.R. Tolkien]]'' (2024).{{CP|182}} == See also == * [[Letter 205a]] * [[Letter 206]] {{references}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hobbit Dinner in Rotterdam}} [[Category:Events (real-world)]]
